newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile February retail sales fall one percent.
newsitem.headline: Chile February retail sales fall one percent.

text.p: Chilean retail sales fell one percent in February from the same month last year, while sales grew 5.8 percent in January, said the National Chamber of Commerce.
February was the first month sales have fallen since November 1994, when they dropped 0.8 percent, said chamber president Alfonso Mujica.
The figures showed sales increased 2.3 percent in the first two months of the year compared with the January-February period last year.
Sharpest increases in sales were seen in the footware industry, up 28 percent, and clothing sales, which grew 19 percent in the first two months of the year.
Lower sales were seen in the furniture sector, down 22 percent and construction material distribution which fell 17 percent.
